comments.commentBody: After months of establishing with his base that the NYT et al is "fake", "lying", "failing", and "dishonest", Trump can now counter any negative issues that arise by claiming that a similar event has been perpetrated by his opponents.  His backers believe his tweets and his supportive media outlets with the same certainty that we believe the NYT.  We are certain that they are ignorant and misinformed and they are equally certain about us.  This feels like an episode of Black Mirror.

Can and will anyone put this context? 6 weeks-- no one can believe or expect that the situation will improve. Unfortunately, we are in a HUGE morass. No religion (that's a joke!) can save us--our salvation is to engage civil society and continue the relentless pressure (its so difficult for me to name this person; besides being so embarrassed). I promise you that he will continue to breakdown. The failure of congress is pathetic--I cannot accept their burying their heads in sand--this cannot last much longer otherwise we will suffer irrevocable unintended or intended consequences. (I do hope the media will expose the TRUTH--you never know--maybe we'll lucky get lucky?).
Just because you are paranoid, does not mean there are not people after you.

"nascent" was appropriate a while ago. perhaps "moribund" is more appropriate.
can't believe it's happening so fast.

Can't wait for Mike Pence to start taking charge somewhat of this clock gone wild. What we have is someone so chaotic, disorganized and to say the least belittles the office his handlers help hand to him. There is there there no question about it given all this panic tirades. sick

Even if true, Trump’s latest accusation against President Obama doesn’t concern me in the slightest. In fact, I’d applaud if it happened.

The telephone lines of all known political nutcases ought to be monitored by our government 24 hours a day for reasons of public safety; so if President Trump’s phones aren’t already being tapped, somebody should begin doing it right away.
12:00 p.m.: Huge container of Kentucky Fried Chicken for lunch

Jeff Sessions needs to resign and we need to see Trump's taxes for the past 5-10 years. The Executive Branch is trying to distract the masses from concerns regarding the necessity for an independent prosecutor investigating the  Administration's contacts and dealings with Russia.

trump is cracking. he is unwell and can't take the heat that truth brings with it. he will crack completely and we Americans need to protect ourselves, the nation, and democracy against this mentally unbalanced man. Period.

Yes, this may be true. And, if necessary there is an amendment to the Constitution that can come into play. But, are his minions heading the executive departments willing to take action, if necessary? I doubt it. I never, ever thought I would say this: I fear a military coup.

Another point: People fear domestic police forces but at least they are trained to serve the public, even if they fail at times. ICE is not trained this way. Police are not to arrest without probable cause. ICE has much broader powers in deporting undocumented persons. Trump perceives, and has termed, his immigration enforcement as a military operation. The military are precluded from policing the US. The National Guuard is called out only in emergencies--natural and man-made. They patrolled the streets of Baltimore during and after the April 2015 riots. Once their job was complete, they demobilized. ICEdoes not even have this discipline or role. What has Trump unleashed?
The President of our country.  What an embarrassment.  And a disgrace.
My prior comment stating that the Movie "Manchurian Candidate" was on TV tonight was wrong. My sincerest apologies to all.

The guy doesn't have a presidential cell in his body.
No one with half a brain was fooled by that bad acting job on Tuesday night.

These reckless wiretapping allegations bring to mind the "please proceed, Governor" moment of that debate back in 2012. Trump's cooking his own goose. Please proceed, Mr. Meltdown.

[[he 1) denies; 2) distracts; 3) normalizes and then if all of that fails to throw off the heat, he 4) attacks.]]

So does Hillary Clinton.

With any luck, Trump's gyrations are as annoying and exhausting to his staff as they are to the public.

Our Internet users fought for Trump a year. Trump emerged countless mistakes, We all repaired for him and Firmly supported him. This is the election of "Normandy". But Trump surrendered about Illegal immigration policy only a month. How such a person can battle Real Normandy? Trump is the real woman, We helped the woman win 2016 election. Ms.Trump breaked the glass ceiling. Internet users, Do not help Trump any more. Next year midterm elections, Election of 2020, I will not vote for GOP. GOP is same Dems. Male and female are same.
Could you repeat that please.

Trump still reads the New York Times and watches CNN, if only to complain about them, but he now construes the mainstream media to be purveyors of “fake news.” Instead, he gives full credence to reports on Fox News (terror attack in Sweden!) and Breitbart. In addition, Trump's distrust of the intelligence agencies means he prefers to believe and to repeat this outrageous and dangerous claim about the Obama Administration. However, as the Michael Flynn case should remind him, intelligence agencies routinely monitor communications with Russian diplomats and spies. One does not need to issue wiretaps against the Trump campaign in order to discover that his campaign operatives have had discussions with a number of Russians. One only has to monitor the Russians themselves.

For most of his life, Trump has been able to bully and bluster his way past any opposition. He has used non-disclosure forms to silence both colleagues and underlings, and lawsuits to mitigate any claims against him. He assumed that as the occupant of the White House, he would have unlimited power and could operate by fiat. Instead, he is slowly discovering that this is still a nation of laws, where even the Attorney General had to recuse himself from the Russian investigation.

Breitbart News connected a few random dots in a superficial way. The full picture of the Trump campaign’s dealings with Russia has yet to be shown. However, when that day comes, I can only imagine the twitter storm Trump will unleash.

What does it take for the Senate committee that's investigating this administration to look at Mr. Trump's income tax returns.  I simply don't understand.  This seems to me to be a very important part of any investigation of this man.  What gives?
It takes a Democratic majority, which is not coming soon nor may ever. The Republicans have a chance to permanently marginalize us. Think they will go for it?

The answer is easy. There is no law requiring a presidential candidate to make available their returns for review as part of the nominating process. Anyone taking the extraordinary efforts to conceal their returns, obviously have something to hide. In addition, an individual's tax returns over a long period of time is like a biography of that persons financial life and even their personal life to an extent. If Trump's returns were made public everything he has said up to now about his business dealings would have to correspond with what is on his tax returns.
If there was an ongoing investigation I suppose Congress or a court could subpoena his returns. With an overwhelming majority of Republicans in control they're probably afraid he might " tweet " something and his base will primary any offending congressperson in the next election.
That's why you won't see his returns. They're afraid of him.
Notice how the Republicans are so strangely silent on the Russian hacking of the Democrats?
They're scared of him. Pathetic.

Endless political theater. Is Sessions really colluding with the Russians? Of course not, but it gets onto the front page and into the mouths of the mass chatterers. Did Obama wire Trump Tower? Of course not, but it gets the Sessions story less attention to say so. This is all just diversion and low politics. Any trace of an improvement to the ACA anywhere? Any humane and enforceable immigration policy on the horizon? Of course not--not with all this clowning around taking the stage.

Both parties are totally irresponsible and engaged in dereliction of duty.
Both parties? Huh? Classic false equivalent.

You believe that Jeff Sessions colluded with the Russians to interfere in the election? Against American interests? That Obama ordered surveillance on Trump Tower. We are watching a game. It is grist for the 24/7 news cycle that we crave. The media must feed the beast. We must click and switch and read and watch and listen--to nothing.

Since the President cannot order extrajudicial wiretaps, if they occurred, they would have been illegal.  Thus either Trump has committed actionable libel against Barrack Obama, or the FISA court issued a warrant based on reasonable suspicion that Trump was engaged in illegal activity or activity that endangered national security.  Which is it, Mr. President?

President Trump has started negotiations for the terms of investigation by any Special Prosecutor or Commission. This is the first salvo. The message is "If you continue pushing for investigation of the Russia connection, Obama administration actions will be part of the investigation, making it a double edged sword".
All Americans who care about the integrity of their leaders and political system should call this bluff. We trust that a capable lawyer appointed by a Republican Attorney General or a Republican Congress will reach the truth. We must have an investigation and know the truth. Did the Trump campaign collude/ make a deal with Russia to interfere in the elections? Did the US government target the Trump campaign? The need for answers is urgent.

I don't trust this particular Republican Attorney General to appoint a capable lawyer and then give him or her free rein. I agree that the need for answers is urgent, but I don't find it reassuring to have Jeff Sessions in the seat. Congress may be marginally better, as there are some Republicans there who aren't comfortable with this whole mess.

For Trump's purposes, the accusation that Obama tapped his phones doesn't have to be true. Republicans have been using this same trick for the last twenty years, at least. They say something outrageous and not true to get it into the conservative blog sphere, on talk radio and Fox News. When proven false, they say "Well, so what? It could have been true." And as far as the 30% of the electorate that forms the conservative base, it will always true going forward. His supporters will use this on the campaign trail in conservative districts. It generates outrage and hatred toward Democrats. The accusation now has a life of its own, and there's no way to fight it.
Kind of like the allegations of Trump's Russian involvement.  Still no evidence.  Just democrats generating anger toward and distrust of Trump.

Just like Trump, make up whatever fake stories you want and those dumbbell Americans out there will believe him. All this because he does not want to release his tax records that will indicate his close relationship to Russia and Putin.  The guy is a thug who has a bunch of liars working for him.  This election was a non violent coup and now we have those in power that are rolling back everything good for the monetary benefit of themselves and those that support them.  Unless the Republicans start opposing his lame brain ideas they will all be voted out of office come next election, that is unless they kiss enough behinds and receive a lot of money from lobbyists that they help.  Our government is broken and getting more broken.
They will win again if they don't let opponents vote.

The "by the people and of the people" parts haven't yet perished. Remember a minority of my compatriots voted for Trump. I would venture to guess that in their narrowly focused world the "for the people" part is still valid too. It remains for Trump to burn down the Capitol then ask Congress for a suspension of the Constitution and indefinite permission to rule by decree for us to lose the whole thing. Stay tuned.

Taste is so personal and unpredictable, changing and inconsistent.

Donald's gustatory habits are only of mild interest - I don't remember any of his mean tweets aimed at others' food choices, although I do remember a few cruel references to Chris Christie's excesses.

I am much more concerned about his tastes in policies and politics and polemic - which are truly bizarre by any standards.

Let's not forget that buried in his insane, unsupported and dangerous diatribe of tweets about the wiretapping of his phones by Obama, he couldn't help but spend his "presidential" coin on another tweet about Arnold Schwarzenegger and the Apprentice TV show.

So our President spent another $3.5 million dollar weekend at Mar-a-loco eating steaks (well done with ketchup) and playing golf and all we got were those dam* tweets?

Trump can't let go of the Apprentice.

Why can't he just go back to doing that? I'd gladly watch again. I was a big fan and watched many of the seasons until it became Celebrity Apprentice.

I don't like the spinoff- Presidential Apprentice- and I hope it gets cancelled soon.

Why are you writing about these trivial things, Mr. Bruni?

I could care less what Trump eats, or that his wife wears a sequined suit to the State of the Union.

You have a powerful platform here in the NYTimes.

Don't waste it.

Au contraire! Bruni is making an important and valid point: If anti-Trumpists feel the need to criticize, in the most insulting terms, *everything* the president does, his legions will feel justified in dismissing every other criticism as the overheated responses of haters.
I haven't been focusing on these things, the media has. They did it throughout the seemingly endless election slog. That is why we ended up with Trump.
He's actually making an important point about how trivia trivializes the real issues, but you seem to have missed that.

He's jealous after Pres. Obama got that rousing reception from New Yorkers when he visited last week. And too, distracting from his real problems. This smoke really isn't that thick to those of us who still think for ourselves.
